hasVariant.name: Backwoods Snowboard - 2025
hasVariant.description: Buy the Weston Backwoods Snowboard - 2025 online or shop all Snowboard from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Backwoods Snowboard - 2025
hasVariant.description: Buy the Weston Backwoods Snowboard - 2025 online or shop all Snowboard from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The Backwoods split is an all-time favorite for me. This board surfs pow with so much play and nimbleness. The directional taper allows me to ride a 152 with a pack and not have to worry about sinking my 5'6" 160lb self too much. It especially comes alive in tight trees and I've even taken it into the air a bit.
review.name: Does it all

review.reviewBody: One of my favorite boards, I love the freeride shape that does more than meets the eye. I've sessioned everything from the fabled fields in BC to the steep Chutes of Telluride. Somehow this board which disguises itself as fun directional freeride board handles so much more. I'm not taking it into the park, but I'm not hesitating to hit hippie jibs and backcountry booters.
review.name: One of the greats

review.reviewBody: The Weston Backwoods is an absolute quiver killer for me. I ride it in all conditions at Killington in Vermont. Its favorite place to ride is tight birch glades, where it floats on powder thanks to its large nose and it slips effortlessly in between trees with a short tail. The rugged polyamid top sheet sheds snow, keeping the board light and nimble. Donâ€™t let all of this talk about powder fool you though. The backwoods has plenty of camber underfoot for even the firmest of days here on the Ice Coast! I have put literally hundreds of days on my Backwoods snowboard and cannot recommend it enough!
review.name: Pow Board and So Much More!

review.reviewBody: Super fun board that can handle pretty much all conditions. I've been rocking the Backwoods here in the PNW and it has been awesome. Super nimble and floaty in the PNW pow. I always have a smile at the end of my runs. Itâ€™s crazy how well it floats. If youâ€™re looking for a board that is awesome in the trees, can shred deep open bowls, and get to it on groomers, the Backwoods is for you.
review.name: Float machine

review.reviewBody:
Its a one stop shop with the backwoods. from tight trees and narrow couloirs to open bowls and steeps. from deep pow to choppy and variable conditions I have put the backwoods to the test and haven't been let down. its rugged top sheet is resistant to the normal wear and tear you would see with other boards and sheds snow so you don't get bogged down with extra weight on those spring days. 

When packing for a trip the backwoods is always my board of choice as it can handle anything you throw at it with ease!
review.name: Quiver Killer

name: Backwoods Snowboard - 2025

review.reviewBody: I had some Chesters on my trial bike. Good Pedal, but was getting a slight bit of chatter on aggressive DH. These solved that problem. Very sticky, light and slightly thiner than the Chesters. Are they worth $150 compared to the $50? Up to you, but if you are reading this you probably already decided that first.
review.name: Very sticky

review.reviewBody: I have purchased 4 pairs of these peddles and ridden them thousands of miles.  They work great for grip and will destroy your shins if you smack into them, but sometimes the flat falls off of the axle.  The problem is insufficient number of threads to hold the flat on.  To make things more interesting, I have found it nearly impossible to repair in the field with a portable allen wrench so I now carry normal allens in my repair kit and I've found that blue thread sealer helps hold the peddles together.  So far I've always been able to find my peddle when it flies off, but losing your peddle over a cliff or in the rocks would really suck, so to be sure, I now take a new pair apart and loctite them to begin with.
review.name: Great peddles, need locktite.

review.reviewBody:
Updated. I purchased these specifically because Race Face stated that the new axle design was compatible with carbon crank boots. Not even close, adding additional washers us the only option just like Oneup's aluminum pedal. Save your money and go with a cheaper option. 

Raceface sent out some specific pedal washers that about 1mm thicker than standard. I still had to remove a slight amount of material from the crank boots but this now allowed fitment on my xx1 carbon cranks with boots.
review.name: New design is still not compatible. Upda

review.reviewBody:
I've been riding these pedals for the past couple months and have been super happy with them. They are lighter than the previous version, offer longer pins for extra bite, and the profiling allows them to smoothly skip over any obstacle you might strike with them. I've hit several rocks with these pedals and they hardly show any signs of wear. The pins are all straight and haven't been damaged from these impacts.

Grip is on par with some of the best pedals I have ridden from HT and Deity. The oversized bearing on the spindle makes these pedals super smooth and I suspect will increase durability. As the other reviewer noted, these pedals may not work with all carbon crank boots. They likely won't fit into a crank arm rack like you find on many shuttle services, however I have always found this to be a minor inconvenience as most shuttle services are prepared for pedals like these and offer additional racking options. 

If you're in the market for a durable, sleek, and functional flat pedal take note of these. The only problem you might encounter is these being too grippy when you're throwing your one-footed whips.
review.name: Traction Devices

name: Atlas Pedals

review.reviewBody: This warm and cozy vest is great to wear on cold days.The exterior vest  material  is soft and fuzzy. The interior material has a soft mesh lining on the chest. The  lining on the interior back of the vest is the same fuzzy material that is on the exterior. It is comfortable and breathes well. The vest has three zippered deep mesh lined pockets which are great for storing items. The mesh lining is lightweight and quick drying. I am very happy with this vest and will enjoy its warmth and coziness.
review.name: Warm and fuzzy vest

review.reviewBody: This has been a lifesaver. Love this vest! Wish they had more color options.
review.name: Super Soft and Warm!

review.reviewBody: I like the color and fit is true to size. Iâ€™m 5â€™1â€ so pretty short but have a long torso and this vest is longer than any other vest I have. Itâ€™s not a deal breaker but good to know.
review.name: Pretty long

review.reviewBody: I am 5â€™6â€, 34DD, 140 lbs and purchased both the medium and large. Returned the large and kept the medium. Dusky Brown is a great brown-dark mauve color.
review.name: Love mine

review.reviewBody: I agree with the odd fit. Kind of boxy, definitely too big. I will be returning for a size XS to see if thats better.  A littler longer than I would like too but its cozy and I really want to like it
review.name: Weird sizing

review.reviewBody: I have several E bikes over the past four years and this is the best bike I've owned...period. Love the mullet setup. It flicks around corners in the bike park with ease. It is so light you will forget you are riding an E bike. Steering is precise. Climbs very well. I cannot keep up with full powered E bikes with a 85nM motor, but pretty close...and it is lighter, more flickable, and does not dive hard like a 55lb E bike. Mine is right at 41 lbs with ENVE wheels, Hope brakes/rotors, and a Fox 36. The entry level shock is actually really good, but I'm moving to a PUSH 11.6 when they finish testing simply bc I already own the shock (which is amazing). Geometry is perfect, aggressive, solid for extreme riding. The only issue I have is finding a dropper that fits. The stock Tellis 160 could not be push to the seat collar, so it left 3inches of tube out and I like to bury mine for park...so I purchased a 150mm OneUP and I just have to lower it for rowdier descents. Small price to pay for such a stellar bike. Crested Butte, Trestle, Virginia Canyon...it handles it all with grace and supple suspension
review.name: Absolutely amazing

name: Heckler SL S E-Bike

review.reviewBody: I bought this for an upcoming safari in Africa, and I am confident it will protect me while making me look great, too. It's a lightweight, drapey fabric, in a light icy blue color. I love it!

review.reviewBody: It's soft and looks good, the neckline was just too close to my neck for me and I knew I would never wear it because of that, so I returned it.

review.reviewBody: Great breathable and comfortable fabric. Nice design. Product is great quality.

review.reviewBody: I love this garment's light weight and hoodie style, which I bought specifically for working in my yard and for hikes while traveling. And the palm green color is my favorite!
review.name: Perfect lightweight hoodie!

review.reviewBody: I love the color and how soft the material is. Itâ€™s a nice light weight material perfect for laying. My only negative and reason for the three stars is the neck/hoodie. Iâ€™m sure itâ€™s designed to be snugger than the average hoodie but itâ€™s a bit odd for me. It would be perfect with the hoodie up under a ball cap to prevent wind in your neck.
review.name: Style is a bit meh!

review.reviewBody: Wife and daughter love them. They fit a little too tight given the size call-out. Good quality.
review.name: Hoodie review

review.reviewBody: I love the color and fabric; it is very soft and dries quickly. I'm disappointed in the fit, though. The arms are a bit short/tight when my thumbs are in the arm socket, but the body of the hoodie is overly baggy. I wish I could size down, but then I fear the arms would be way too short. I would be returning this except I washed it before I tried it on and now the tag is gone. Bummer : (
review.name: Super soft, but bad fit on me

review.reviewBody: Super comfortable and buttery soft - exactly what you'd expect out of a bamboo blend. I love it for everyday wear, not just sun protection.
review.name: Buttery Soft!

review.reviewBody: Love the lightweight hoodies and the palm green color
review.name: Hoodies that go everywhere

review.reviewBody: Everything about this hoodie is my favorite! I love the fit, feel, and color. Wearing a lightweight hoodie and only having to apply sunscreen from the neck up is the way to go. The hoodie felt cool on my skin while backpacking in the summer heat of the CA Sierra. I bought a size M and am 138 lbs, 5'3", and have a 34-36 bust size.
review.name: My Favorite Backpacking Hoodie

Love to wear long sleeves over short sleeves for sun protection and this jersey is great for that! Not too hot when the temp is high but also okay for cooler temps. Definitely recommend!

Not a jersey I would send it off of gnarly terrain, but so perfect for the everyday.

review.reviewBody: Loved the look of this jersey, and itâ€™s really hard to find long sleeve jerseys for DH. It was a little pricy, so I was expecting better quality. The fabric is pretty thin, which could be nice for breathability, but is was almost mesh-like and likely wouldnâ€™t hold up. Also had zero stretch and I could barely get it over my head. Iâ€™m 5â€™2 and 110 lbs and got the small. I have a short torso so it was a little long, but the fact that the neck had zero stretch and was pretty tight and almost didnâ€™t fit over my head was a deal breaker. Not worth it!

review.reviewBody: Sometimes it's hard to tell. I even have them in my hands if I don't look down at them. I mean it's 170 g of pole folks. It just doesn't get lighter than this. review.reviewBody: These poles are insanely light, but stiff. Love them for touring, makes up for gaining that extra 5lbs over the holidays.

review.reviewBody: I've always been leary of carbon poles in the bc, but BD had a good sale and l picked these up. I rarely adjust my pole height and these work great for me. I bought them 5 cm taller than I usually tour at, which was a good decision. Long grip and straps work very well. I'd give them 5 stars, but the jury's still out on durability.

description: Buy the Ravemen FR160 Headlight online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: FR160 Headlight
hasVariant.description: Buy the Ravemen FR160 Headlight online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Since getting this, I haven't had any drivers pull out in front of me or pedestrians walk out in front of me. Seems to improve my visibility on the road. I only use it during daylight in flash mode. It runs for a long time and integrates nicely on an out front garmin type mount holding my garmin 130 plus computer on top for a lightweight low profile setup.
review.name: Excellent daytime light

review.reviewBody: The lamp has excellent visibility but could be improved in one area. I often get out early before the sun is up, and the light, when on full bright, does not illuminate the road directly in front of the bike. This would be a great lamp if it had a setting that provided that. I must use an additional lamp that can point downward in conjunction with the Ravemen. The Garmin attachment makes for a solid fit with the bike attachment.
review.name: Great visibility, but could do better

review.reviewBody: When I purchased my new Look road bike it had an adapter for the Garmin computer. But I did not want to stack tack equipment across the handle bar. This light fit the bill as it works with the Garmin adapter and has the fitting on top for the Garmin computer. This is exactly what I needed/wanted. I like the assortment of running configurations for the light from steady state, to quick blink, slower blink etc. Though experience is limited so far as my longest ride with it to date is only 4hrs, it appears to hold the charge quite well
review.name: Multi functional light; very visible

review.reviewBody: Doesnâ€™t pop loose ever from bar bracket. Must have for compact setup
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: Love that this is compatible with my Garmin and super easy to use. Def recommend.
review.name: PERFECT!

name: FR160 Headlight

review.reviewBody: Works as designed.  Tested it heavily in the Grand Canyon.  Only flaw is in the thread design for the cap.  Very tricky to tighten properly.  Be sure to check it once you think you have it on to confirm it's not leaking or going to leak when pressure is applied to it.

review.reviewBody: I just bought it a few weeks ago, and filled it for the first time last Friday. It leaked all around the place where the lid joins to the pouch. Sorely disappointed.
review.name: Leaks. I should have read the other reviews.

review.reviewBody: We went hiking in high temperatures and I was impressed with how cool my water stayed during extended times outside.
review.name: Keeps Your Water Cold

review.reviewBody:
I replaced my previous one because it was very hard to get the lid to seal without leaking. When I successfully got it to seal, it would be very difficult to unscrew. The new one has the same issue, It is painstaking to get t
it to thread correctly.
review.name: lid

review.reviewBody:
Excellent hydration bladder.
Keeps ice frozen for around 5 hrs in 90 degrees F compared to 2 hours without the insulated sleeve (attached on the outside of a pack). Easy to fill the bladder with ice and water.

You do not have to take the hydration bladder out of the insulated sleeve to fill with water and ice. Large opening and easy to hold handle makes filling very easy. Some have complained about challenges with the screw cap. I suggest marking the screw cap and bladder with a silver sharpie, so youâ€™ll know where to start threading the cap.

Only negative is it takes up more room in your pack, but thatâ€™s the trade off for cooler water.

Weâ€™ve also used it for outdoor concerts, picnics, and itâ€™s excellent for golfing, especially when you walk the course

Highly recommend this product
review.name: Excellent Hydration Bladder and Insulated Sleeve

review.reviewBody: Very happy with this product

review.reviewBody: I ended up selling these to a friend because the thighs were way too big and the fabric was too thin.
review.name: too big in the thighs

review.reviewBody:
Not for regular-fit legs, unfortunately. 
I am 163 cm, 53 kg and according to a size table on their website, I could fit XS or S (0-2). 
Had to return the trail pants (ordered size S) because they were too tight in the calf area and very wide around the waist and hips.
Probably, if you have very curvy hips and skinny ankles/calves this model could work for you. 
Otherwise, I do not recommend it. 
As for other characteristics, very lightweight material, NOT water-resistant as the description claimed, colors are accurate.
Very disappointed, had to return it and pay for a shipping label. I wish the store had offered an exchange to simply update the size, not to go through the return-re-buy process.
review.name: Strange fit: size chart is not accurate

review.reviewBody: Right size
Wish they packed smaller into my bag. Also might be able to reduce weight with some cut outs. Lots of metal.
review.name: Good quality but I wish they packed better

review.reviewBody: I purchased these for my Moment Wildcats that are mounted with a Pivot Cast system. These crampons performed exceptionally during my trip to Tahoe in early April. These brought me up some bulletproof morning sierra skinners that wouldn't have been possible without. They engage with the snow effortlessly and release without drag/catching. I was putting my full body weight on one side to hold an edge in steep ice and expected these to be all bent out of shape, but to my surprise they were good as new afterewards. Super impressed with the strength for the relatively light weight crampons. If you have a Pivot Cast you have no other options, and if you don't these are a fantastic option for you.
review.name: The Best Ski Crampons

review.reviewBody: Does the job. Solid construction, easy to install and remove. Somewhat restricts gliding on level or short downhills.
review.name: Quality skinning crampons

They are really comfortable and I often forget that I'm wearing them. There's minimal smudging, no fogging, and they cover my entire field of vision.

review.reviewBody: I purchased these flywheel based on quality and claim from company that they would stand behind their products and have filed a claim which they are saying they will honor. I use these only sporadically and on boat and take care of them but these glasses seem to be bad from start as the screw came off and they cracked. Now they state that itâ€™s not covered under warranty. If you are purchasing based on their claim of quality and support save yourself the trouble DONT as you will be disappointed and left stranded like me.
review.name: Beware do not purchase without reading this !!

review.reviewBody: have ben using for hiking, skiing, mountain biking. Have been great
review.name: Great shades

review.reviewBody: Really nice cycling "goggles". Fits well with my helmet, doesn't obstruct my view as a road cyclist, and has good coverage and lens clarity.
review.name: Cycling Glasses

review.reviewBody: Exactly what I was hoping for - sleek style and very comfortable. The size was perfect and the nose adjustment works well to adjust how much wind moves around them making them function extremely well across temperature ranges. The lens is dark and works really well to block bright light, but transitions perfectly to mid light shade situations.
review.name: Exactly what I was hoping

review.reviewBody: Super light, perfect fit. Lens darkens perfectly on sunny days. When the fog rolled in the lens didn't change and was too dark to be usable. Also the bag was too small. Thought this would be an all conditions gear. Still a big Smith fan... but have to find a different lens.
review.name: Super light, perfect fit. Lens

review.reviewBody: Get the ChromaPop Rose Gold Mirror Lens. Fantastic in cycling by all weather. 4 stars because i'm not so fan of the blue frame color. Can't stand for these lenses with black frame ðŸ˜ I Hope.
review.name: Great fit and style

review.reviewBody: Bought these beauties for running outside. Have used them in warm and chilly conditions and work great. They also allow your glasses to attached...bur haven't figured out how yet. First Smith purchased and very happy!
review.name: Sunny/Cloudy & Warm/Chilly

review.reviewBody: I was sold on the look alone. Performance is outstanding, durability is great as these have lasted 2 years with only a couple of minor scratches. Between cycling, running and skiing these glasses have seen a bit of everything and continue to deliver. Only issue I notice is the noise grip is slowly becoming a bit weaker and will pop open more often and I just have to adjust it back.
review.name: Great Fit and Design

description: Buy the Metolius Magnum Crash Pad online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Magnum Crash Pad
hasVariant.description: Buy the Metolius Magnum Crash Pad online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I didn't feel a need to review this pad until I bought some cheaper pads for my garage climbing wall and saw how high quality this metolius is comparably.

It is worth the price for the size. Very useful size I don't see the point in these 36x48 pads that you need 2 of. 

This pad is very firm and I like that. I could knock the wind out of me if I fall flat on my back from a roof but that is not a typical fall for me.

This pad is not a great bed because it is too firm but it is a good couch.

the angled hinges, good fabric, tight fitting cover and firm foam put the madrock pads I bought to shame. It is fine because the madrock pads  were 25 percent off and were significantly cheaper, and I needed 4 of them for my garage.

 This pad is miles ahead in quality. I would recommend this to anyone. Don't be afraid of the size bigger is better. do cost per square foot analysis it is not that much more expensive than some cheaper options.
review.name: Noice

name: Magnum Crash Pad

review.reviewBody: The kayak is beautiful. However, the directions were poor. I am still having difficulty to pair the motor with the remote.
review.name: aBad directions and the remote will not pair with

review.reviewBody:
No one makes a better fishing kayak. Period.
Grampa always told me, "You get what you pay for, son."
review.name: Top of the Line

review.reviewBody: What a beast! Iâ€™ve owned several other Old Town kayaks (Predator MK, Sportsman PDL), and this one is by far the most stable. Feels like a personal bass boat, and you can stand and fish for days. And the I-pilot is truly amazing. The only con for this kayak is the very limited access to inside the hull/in-hull dry storage, but thatâ€™s far outweighed by all of the other pros for this kayak.
review.name: Couldnâ€™t be happier

review.reviewBody:
My Old Town Autopilot 136 in gray Ghost Limited Edition arrived yesterday. Was wrapped nicely in heavy gauge plastic to protect it. After unwrapping and looking it over I found the Kayak to be of very thick and well-built materials. It is a heavy craft but the quality is amazing. Customer service was very easy to deal with and quite helpful getting me the answers I needed. Very spacious kayak and lots of room for everything I want to add.
Cons- I wish they gave an option for aluminum rails to replace the plastic ones. Though the plastic ones are strong I just like heavy duty for fish finders etc.
I also wish they would list the model number of the included trolling motor to make it easier for looking up spare or backup parts.
Would I recommend this kayak to friends? without a doubt.
review.name: Better than I had expected

review.reviewBody: Is there a 2022 model yet and will there be a 2023 model different from the previous years? Also from what i see the 45 lb thrust motor doesn't cut it for speed compared to other electric motor options that have speeds up to 15mph. I would however like to troll offshore in Florida on calm days which requires about 5 - 7 mph. Will there be any other motor options in the future? I've seen many many comments regarding that so I dont see why such a simple option wouldn't be worked in for the consumers. Thank you for any assistance on this matter.
review.name: Questions on 2022 - 2023 Model

review.reviewBody:
I bought my Auto Pilot 136 last summer and canâ€™t say enough good things about it. It does a great job operating while fishing in a moving river, and makes those long trips across the lakes effortless. Iâ€™ve had issues with the spot lock under or next to bridges but it has never been a large margin of error. Weight is an issue being solo but with the correct gear itâ€™s no problem. The storage area is like the trunk of a car, definitely great for all day fishing. 
This kayak immensely increases my fishing time while on the water, leaving me plenty of room to stand and fish, not feeling cluttered by fishing and camera equipment. Itâ€™s very well balanced for me even at 6â€™3â€ tall. There are some issues  like the drainage in the cup holders, but nothing that affects my fishing or time on the water.
If kayak fishing is what you like, and you are out there a lot, itâ€™s most certainly worth the $
review.name: Love my AP 136

name: Sportsman Autopilot 136 Kayak

hasVariant.description: Buy the Big Agnes Blacktail 3 Tent: 3-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I am a new backpacker who made my first trip in an REI Trailmade.  It felt very confined inside with my wife and myself.    When I was searching for something more roomy I found the Mountain Hardwear Mineral King and Backcountry had a great price.   The Mineral King has a ridge pole that makes a tremendous difference in holding the sides nearly vertical which makes it easy for two adults to sit inside at the same time without feeling confined.  We also love the huge doors that store simply in a stash pocket.  Finally, we just think this is a great looking tent.  We got a Big Agnes Blacktail 3p for comparison and it was bigger, but the looks, big doors and roominess inside made us pick the Mountain Hardwear Mineral King.   We have taken it on two trips and are thrilled with our choice.  We use a Big Agnes Rapide SL Insulated Tent Floor Pad which is 50â€ wide tapering to 40â€.   It fits nicely and the taper makes the corners near our feet good places to store gear that we want handy.
review.name: Love the roominess

review.reviewBody:
I'm a motorcycle traveler and been on the road for 4 years and gone through as many tents, this one the zipper went out in less than 5 months and customers service won't help me!
Cannot recommend at all!!!
review.name: Buyer beware

review.reviewBody: The Blacktail two, three, and four-person tents are light enough for the backcountry, and strong enough for the front country. A tried and true shelter with excellent value for backpackers who want a super comfortable tent after a long day on the trail. The Blacktail series of tents offers spacious sleeping areas with easy access through two, side-entry doors and vestibules, making early morning entry and exit with a tent-mate more stealth when nature calls.
review.name: Blacktail Series

review.reviewBody: Took this car camping in Lake Tahoe mid-October. No condensation, and got pretty cold at night. Fit my 5'9 boyfriend and myself, 5'6, very comfortably. We could probably have fit a dog in too, but we used the extra space on the sides for our clothes. Great pockets up top and along the sides. Highly recommend!
review.name: Great tent!

name: Blacktail 3 Tent: 3-Person 3-Season

review.reviewBody: Nice style & fit. Lightweight and packs very small. Comfortable, nice stretch, though it runs small. Unfortunately the fabric isnâ€™t waterproof, itâ€™s much more of a windbreaker. And lack of vents and a non-removable hood make it limited to mountain biking, gravel, and commuting, since the hood would act as an aerodynamic anchor riding on road. Great value for the money.
review.name: Decent trail riding / commuting shell

review.reviewBody:
While riding in a 30 degree day, my back is covered with sweat. It is like being coated in saran wrap because there is no way to dump heat other than the front zipper. 
The jacket is extremely comfortable with its stretch and length. It Packs small enough to fit into the bikes downtube storage box.
If there was a rear vent or pit vents this jacket would be perfect, but since I cannot control my body heat in this jacket, it is not worth it for me.
review.name: Get ready to sweat.

review.reviewBody: Used this sling bag on a recent ski trip and it worked very well. Can pull it around the front when on the lift. Two padded internal pockets make carrying a cell phone and snacks easy.
review.name: Great small ski bag with nice features.

review.reviewBody: I ended up returning it because although it was the cutest bag, the front pocket sat too high and it dug Into my neck and was extremely uncomfortable.. It also made my neck look weird.
review.name: Cute but uncomfortable

review.reviewBody: When looking at sling bags, I was really torn between the Patagonia 8L Sling and the Osprey Daylite Sling. Price wasn't a factor because both are very affordable and I have had great experience with Osprey bags in the past, but finally pulled the trigger on the Patagonia because it is slightly bigger in volume. It's been about 3 months since I got it and love it so much I had to write a review.  The phone pocket is the right size and has stretch material on top so you can add a granola bar or something else in it as well. The smaller top pocket has enough space for a mini pump, spare tube and tire tools, multi tool and sealant, as well as a few other smaller items I need for my cycle commute. The larger bottom pocket fits my rain pants and jacket with enough room to fit an additional layer or two if the weather calls for it. But the biggest surprise is that I've used the compression straps on top far more often than I thought I would.  They are great for holding anything from helmet to food containers or the random stray stuffed animal I find along the trail. Another bonus is the clip in the top pocket, perfect for keys or my Trayvax wallet. Some days I'm amazed at how much gear and other things I can cram into it, I absolutely LOVE this bag!
review.name: Patagonia 8L Sling Bag

review.reviewBody: Bag was made out of quality material.  I think this bag would fit properly on someone under 5'5" and slim.  Also not much room.  Had to return.
review.name: It was too small.

review.reviewBody: Smaller than I'd hoped it would be, especially the phone pocket in the front.  My Samsung plus model won't fit.  Will be returning.
review.name: Super Cute but small

review.reviewBody: I am always on the go.  I walk or ride my bike to work and downtown to run errands or meet friends.  This is perfect to replace my purse.  Itâ€™s just the right size to fit my wallet, a few essentials and my phone.  The sling works way better than a purse or backpack.  I love the ability to swing it around to access the zippers without having to take it off line I would a backpack or have all the pressure on one shoulder like my purse.  This is perfect for the sporty Woman on the go and the Joy/pitch blue color is vibrant and fun.  Love it!
review.name: Perfect every day bag

review.reviewBody: I love the size of this bag, it not only makes it easier to take with you on a hike or on-the-go but also great to get something out of the bag without having to actually take it off of you. Definitely recommend for light travel and when you're on-the-go!
review.name: Perfect On-The-Go Sling

review.reviewBody: Finally my Iphone fits in the zipper pocket. Gone is the pesky separator that did nothing but take up room. I really like the updates and will get another color. Sure wish Patagonia would make a purple one for us who like some feminine colors to carry. For now black and navy will work for me. It's not super large and does not have a back slip pocket but it works for on the go and for travel.
review.name: A better Atom

review.reviewBody: I like this bag, and searched far and wide for a slingback that was going to be as versatile as my old one. (The zipper broke and they changed the design) On this Patagonia bag, I would like it to be bigger, with longer zippers, since I prefer to open my bags wider and not feel like it was straining as I put things in and take them out.  I feel the narrow strap is quite wimpy on the bottom attachment, and could be wider, fabric instead of nylon, and connected with a swivel latch so you can carry it on either shoulder. As it is, it feels like it could eventually rip out from the main body. I also don?t love the pocket on my chest. It just seems unnecessary. I?m returning mine. I?ll get another one for sure if it gets revamped a bit.
review.name: A good bag with minor changes

name: Atom 8L Sling Bag

review.itemreviewed: Rain Defender Loose Fit Midweight Insulated Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Very warm and comfortable. Lowest temp so far has been 10 degrees. Once the temp started rising to 30 I had to switch to a normal hoodie because it got too warm. My only gripe making it 4 stars is that it does rise up on you from the hips periodically. Maybe should be long enough to reach pants pockets to avoid this. Otherwise it is totally worth the value.
review.name: Like a big warm blanket.

review.itemreviewed: Rain Defender Loose Fit Midweight Insulated Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: the best thing i have felt and very worm and good fit I love it
review.name: good

review.itemreviewed: Rain Defender Loose Fit Midweight Insulated Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: This coat is very weighty,and heavy when you're holding it but doesn't feel that heavy when it's on. It's very wide on the bottom and it has drawstrings but they don't close up the bottom very well so wind still gets in. It is extremely warm if it's zippered up. Unzipped it's like a regular coat. It has very large pockets and a lot of pockets which is good. The outside chest pockets however are very high up and it's awkward to have anything in them. My biggest dislike about this coat is the hood. It doesn't stay up. Ever. No matter what. It just falls back down. In five seconds. And it's a very small sized hood compared to the size, weight and bulk of the coat. Hood fail. If you NEED a hood do not buy this coat. Also the neck flaps where it should fold down on the sides (like at the top of the zipper where it meets the hood) don't stay folded down like the picture and stick straight up and stick you in the face. It's very annoying, especially driving because you turn your head and there's a coat flap in your face. You fold it down, it stands back up. The coat has been washed and I don't see this stiffness getting better any time soon. The loose fit is very loose in the body but not in the arms. I should be a medium but I had to get a large because of the narrow and short arms. The coat looks nice, it gets compliments and it seems well made and like it will last a long time. But for this price it should have a functional hood. That's disappointing.
review.name: Warm but has issues

name: Rain Defender Loose Fit Midweight Insulated Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: I've been wearing RC Wildcats exclusively for YEARS and absolutely love them. Decided to switch things up and try these... they are really comfy and look nice, but are probably the worst mtb shoes I've ever had. Literally no grip, my feet are constantly boucing off the pedals. Birkenstocks would be a better riding shoe comared to these. I have never had this issue with Ride Concepts before, wondering if they changed their sole or something. So disappointing.
review.name: Terrible

review.reviewBody:
I wanted to love the shoes but they just don't work the way I hoped!  

Internally, they're more supportive, shoe hugs the foot and snugs up in all the right places. When I tried stepping on my bike to pedal around, my foot slips off the pedal, multiple times. Shocker. I've used flats for years and never had a slip issue with Five Ten. On closer inspection, comparing the sole material between RC and FiveTen you might notice subtle differences in the materials and pattern. Five Ten's sole has a much stiffer rubber sole, the circles are tighter together and grippier than the RC. RC's has bigger gaps between their octagon shape sole nubs and they don't protrude much. I went back and for a few minutes try one foot with Five Ten and the other with RC. RC kept slipping.  For that reason, had to return and go back to Five Ten.  They run slightly small but also due to lots of internal padding and contouring.
review.name: I wanted to love these shoes but....

name: Livewire Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: My waist size is between 29-30 and this pants in size small fit well with the drawstring. I use them for mainly climbing but the are comfortable for wearing it out and about too. Quality seems to be pretty good. I ended up buying a few more since it was on sale.
review.name: Nice pants

review.reviewBody: They fit me well, are warm, and are comfortable. They are marketed as climbing pants but actually they are not durable at all.  I've had these for a little more than a month and they are already developing tears.  If you're climbing outside on sharper rock likely to abrade pants, these are a poor choice.  I am going to use the pair I have now primarily for indoor climbing.
review.name: ok

review.reviewBody: I use these pants for indoor bouldering. They are roomy without being too big and are perfect for the activity. I can climb for hours without discomfort.
review.name: Great bouldering pants

review.reviewBody: I bought these about a month ago and they are very short. I am 6 foot tall and we about 200 pounds. I bought a large based on recommendations from other reviewers. I have no idea how to return these. Based on pictures from the website, They should be fit much longer . Also, I thought they were a bit stretchier than they are. I would not buy this pair again. Perhaps if they fit like the pictures showed, I would be happier.
review.name: Bad fit

review.reviewBody: Great pants for hiking and climbing. They fit quite well and stretch, making it comfortable to climb on a windy day.
review.name: Great pants

review.reviewBody: The pants are light, comfortable, and rugged. Excellent for traveling, hiking, climbing or just heading to the beach for a surf. I would recommend these pants for any activity.
review.name: All purpose pant

review.reviewBody: Best pants made for climbing. I use these for all disciplines of climbing with the exception of ice. Perfect for milder conditions. Excellent amount of stretch and very breathable. Getting them at a discounted rate was a bonus and truthfully I appreciate the double back pockets on the older version anyway. Colors are great. Thank you Black Diamond for always making the best gear. Never disappointed.
review.name: Best Pants

review.reviewBody: Great fit and fit true to size. Appreciate the nice deep pockets too!
review.name: rugged but not heavy!

review.reviewBody: This is my third pairs from black diamond. I have Fjallraven clothes and Black Diamond material and fits are far superior.
review.name: Third black diamond pants

review.reviewBody: These are very comfortable and well designed pants. I only hope that the new seasons got even better!
review.name: Notion Pants

name: Notion Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: Fit and comfort a 10. Design accents a 0. I do not understand how anyone could design a shoe with accents that show on the side sole appearing to look like dog feces with confetti sprinkled in. I would love to know what I can use to cover up this so-called accent on the side of the soles. Surely I cannot be the same customer with this reaction when they open the box.
review.name: I would buy this product again but not this design.

review.reviewBody: I bought these thinking they would be the same as the Transport except waterproof. I was wrong. They don't fit the same, being much narrower than the original Transport. Back they go with the easy return process. I'm glad I tried them and now I know.
review.name: Not Like Transport

review.reviewBody: I use these sneakers for work and really appreciate how they don't make my back hurt after 8 hours of standing! They stay dry and have good traction, exactly what I was looking for!
review.name: Comfortable and Versatile!

review.reviewBody: I've been using Hokas for the past 10 yrs at least, the best shoes ever. This particular one is great to match with my scrubs at work.
review.name: Love love these shoes

review.reviewBody: These really are waterproof-just came in from a 20 minute walk in the wet grass and pouring rain and my feet are totally dry. Shoes fit snugly true to size. Hoka usually fit me a bit larger, but these work for me. They're comfortable and supportive. They're not a cushiony feel with the goretex, but they serve my needs really well for daily dog walks in the wet grass-and sometimes rain.
review.name: Waterproof!

review.reviewBody: I work in Healthcare which is standing for 8 hrs or longer. This shoes are comfortable and I like that no laces are needed.
review.name: Will be purchasing in different color

review.reviewBody: I tried going up half a size since there is no wide fit but it still hurts my toes so badly. Please make one with a wide width option. I am a medical professional whose on her feet for 14-16 hrs per day and I won't be able to last in my shift wearing this shoe if my feet hurts. :(
review.name: I love the style but I need a wide width option

review.reviewBody: I bought these shoes for travel to Europe during raining season along the Finland and Norway Coasts. I was going to be doing a lot of walking and weather forecast showed possible rain almost every day... but thankfully we had minimal rain on our outings; but when it did rain these shoes were fabulous! They did their job and my feet stayed dried and comfortable! My heel is on the narrow side and my toe box is borderline b/c width. I have several pairs of Hoka tennis shoes but this was the first time I had bought the Transport GTX. I was skeptical of what the material would be and how they would look when I ordered them. To my surprise they look like normal tennis shoes, but yet they were waterproof! The water just beaded up and my feet were dry! No Scotchguard or spray is needed! And while the fabric is a bit different, it is very resilient and I loved that my shoes stayed clean and looked nice my entire three-week trip. Honestly, they still look new! I can easily walk 8-11 miles a day when traveling and exploring, so I wanted the "Hoka" comfort... I got it! I bought these last minute mail order without testing or wearing them and left for my trip a few days later. There is no breaking-in needed... they were comfortable from day one and off I went. My feet never hurt and the fabric did not make my feet sweat or be hot either. I will say the bottoms are a smoother texture and I would not say these would be the best for hiking, I like the sole more rugged for hiking, but they worked perfect for me walking and exploring the city! I wish I had found them for previous travels. Being waterproof is really nice; you never know when it is going to rain and to have this protection AND comfort at the same time is fabulous without taking extra shoes. I usually do take 2 pair of tennis shoes, just for change of pace and color, but I highly recommend the Hoka Transport GTX! They will for sure be in my suitcase when I travel to my next destination.
review.name: These shoes are awesome for travel and unexpected rain!

review.reviewBody: I took two pairs of these on a tour of Iceland where weather can change from sunny to rain in the same day. Recommendation was to have waterproof shoes. Fortunately I didn't have any downpours to deal with but they were comfortable for all of the walking I did. I will use them in the winter when it's wet and not a lot of snow. I tried these in a shoe store before ordering online and I was told to size up a half size.
review.name: Great for Iceland Trip

review.reviewBody: I love the fit of these shoes; a bit more narrow than the original Hokas so fit me better.
review.name: Love it

name: Transport GTX Sneaker - Women's

review.reviewBody: My daughter is in her 2nd winter with these and they have been great!  She is tall and thin...most pants are too short in the legs and wide in the waist, so maybe wouldn't be a great fit for kids that aren't on the lean side. They  have been heavily used at the school yard and on the mountain, and I'm sure we'll be able to pass them along, ever after they get handed down to her brother next year.
review.name: Great pants for second winter

review.reviewBody: I ordered these in a size L (12) for my totally average sized 11 year old.  The large was too small in the waist only, so I sized up to XL (14).  The XL was also way too small in the waist!  Unfortunately, I need to send the second pair back as well.
review.name: Waist is way too smal
comment: Hi, Alexa, Sorry that these didn't fit your 11 year old. We recommend using the size chart above, which includes waist measurements for each size. These pants also feature adjustable waistlines to help you dial in the best fit.

name: Snowshot Insulated Pant - Boys'

description: Buy the Adventure Medical Kits Sportsman Series Medical Kit online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Sportsman Series Medical Kit
hasVariant.description: Buy the Adventure Medical Kits Sportsman Series Medical Kit online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This medical kit is so sleek and easy to pack. It is small and can be put into a weekend bag. It has everything a person could ever need! The whole bag unzips and everything is neatly tucked away in compartments. I have recommended this product to my family. It could save a life.
review.name: Great Pack!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This medical kit is reasonably good for basic first aid situations, is compact, and in a durable case.  Recommended.
review.name: Good medical kit for the scope of it

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I'm a Registered Nurse. I was looking for a high-quality, medical-grade kit to take on long trips. When I received this kit, I was very pleased at the quality of the contents as well as all that was included!! I would be able to take care of many types of injuries until help arrives. A great kit to have, whether medical personnel or not.
review.name: BEST KIT I HAVE EVER SEEN!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got this medical kit for our camping trips. It came with so much more than I expected. It has almost everything you would need for almost any emergency to hold you over until you can get the proper care.
review.name: So many things

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Adventure Medical Kits - Sportsman 400 contains so much stuff! We are planning a hiking trip to Yellowstone this year and this will come in handy. I really appreciate how it has supplies for up to 10 people. We are a family of 5 and I will be great. I love how you can detach the the lightweight kit for a day away from camp and still have everything you need. 

I could not believe how much was included in this kit. I am thankful that we will be prepared for anything that comes our way.
review.name: Contains so much!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This was an awesome assortment of care products. If you are someone who like to be prepared for the unexpected, this kit is for you. Seriously has everything you need for a hunting camp, camper, or even just in the trunk of your car. It comes in an easy to transport bag.
review.name: Perfect for camp!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Every outdoors person out there knows that it's best to prepare for the worst and hope for the best, and this kit is the epitome of preparedness. I took it with on a camping trip with 6 adults and 5 children, and it handled every trouble that came up (small cut from hiking, small burn from cooking, and a decent laceration from hunting). It even helped with a few mosquito bites for the wife and sister in law!
review.name: Great Camping Resource

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a very good kit that fits our needs perfectly. The supplies are of good quality and there are a lot: Some basic medication, one-time use thermometers (two). Bandages, gauze gloves, CPR face shield. It is small in size but packed full of just about everything you would need in an emergency. The way the kit is organized makes it easy to find what you need, it shows what supplies are in the compartment.
review.name: Nice kit with a comprehensive guide book

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This sportsman pack has everything you need to feel safe while out in the wilderness. Plenty of first aid supplies packed neatly into a small pack to handle anything from minor cuts and scrapes to more serious injuries.
review.name: Everything you need

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have three children, 9 years old and younger, so we always have accidents. Cuts, scraps, bumps, and bruised are an everyday occurrence in our household, so I thought this kit would be perfect! I was right! This medical kit has everything I could possibly need to treat our daily boo-boos. It is also really well organized and compact enough that I can store it just about anywhere. I would highly recommend this kit to other families!
review.name: A great variety of supplies!

name: Sportsman Series Medical Kit

review.reviewBody: This seems a little narrow and stiff. If you have normal/narrow feet and want good stabliity for hiking, these could be great. If you have feet that are even a little wide, joint issues, etc. you might not find it to be comfortable. I'm returning them so I can't say anything about how well they hold up.
review.name: Not for me but seems like a good shoe.

review.reviewBody: They fit very comfortably and have the traction needed in a hiking shoe.
review.name: Love them!

review.reviewBody: I really like this shoe's fit and color, but I have only worn mine about 15 times since I've bought them and the side is already showing signs of damage as if I had worn them for a year. I got these shoes so I could do casual hikes in them. I thought they'd be a little more rugged, but I have only hiked in these twice and worn them casually the other times. Very dissapointed that this is already happening, especially for the price point.
review.name: Shoes are already falling apart

review.reviewBody: These shoes are as comfortable as the Hokas I wear to the gym, and have the traction I need for hiking.
review.name: Great hiking shoes

review.reviewBody: Just finished a 5k wearing these Skyline Floats- helped protect my feet and keep me going- just to clarify, I walked the 5k.
review.name: Skyline Float

review.reviewBody: These hiking shoes are too tight. I have regular width feet, I never need a wide fit, and I got these in my usual size in Hoka's, a Women's 6.5. As soon as I put them on they were uncomfortably narrow. I loosened the laces all the way and wore them around my house and they were still way too narrow, they started hurting my feet. I also noticed the heal slides off when walking. These will be returned unfortunately.
review.name: Too tight!

review.reviewBody: I don't like it, I feel that my foot was tired after hours of using it, it's not comfortable for me. The shoelace is annoying keep on detangled, I need to returned it in exchange for a speedgoat. I have 3 SPEEDGOAT and I don't have complained with it I love them so much.
review.name: I DONT LIKE IT

review.reviewBody: I was one of the many Bondi wearers for years who was not happy with the Bondi8 and returned them - I've been patiently waiting for a Bondi9 that is rumored to be back to the bondi6and7 style etc but I and my feet just couldn't wait any longer - So I researched and decided on this Vibram-soled shoe and I think I'm going to LOVE it even more - I've been wearing it since they arrived and walked at least 4-6 miles per day - They are fantastic so this may be my NEW go-to shoe! I highly recommend!! Also I used to wear a 6 1/2 in the Bondi and that is what I ordered and it's perfect -
review.name: LOVE the Skyline-FloatX

review.reviewBody: All purpose use: gym, shopping, evening walks. Excellent quality. Glad to have them!
review.name: Smooth with Sure Footing

review.reviewBody: Loved the midsole and Vibram bottoms, but tight across the forefoot, and couldn't find a lacing hack that stopped my heels from slipping. Other people had the same comments. First time I had this problem with Hokas. I appreciate the return policy that lets you send them back, even if you tried them out.
review.name: Slipping in the heels

name: Skyline-Float X Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: Awesome system!!! The clean bags double as really great longer distance water containers (IE kayaking for a few days with no fresh water available..) can you pretty please sell them in 4L and 6L with caps??? Much more trustworthy than the "Platy bag" with the seal along its length. You might even make the bags so the caps attach with a tether, they're very easily to lose in the field.
review.name: Great products - PLEASE SELL THE CLEAN TANKS AND CAPS!!!

review.reviewBody: I was expecting a Clean reservoir. Got the Dirty replacement. Itâ€™s fine, but do you sell the Clean? The other parts I purchased are perfect. Thanks.
review.name: I was expecting a Clean

review.reviewBody: Hands down the best water filter Iâ€™ve ever used in 30 years of drinking from backcountry streams and lakes. Itâ€™s miraculously easy to set up, walk away and the next time you glance at it you have four liters of clean, clear, and tasteless water. My only gripe is why canâ€™t the Clean reservoir have the same wide zip-loc opening as the Dirty reservoir to allow easier drying and cleaning? The little soda cap opening on the Clean reservoir doesnâ€™t allow enough air exchange to permit proper drying in less than 2 days, promoting mildew growth and more frequent cleaning, which is also a pain because of the small opening. So close to five stars, but not quite.
review.name: Difficult to dry

review.reviewBody:
Great system but there is evidently some product quality issues that make it through as noted with some of these reviews. For me, the Clean bag has delaminated along one side of the hard threaded plastic. This results in water spraying everywhere when filling directly from the Clean bag, or newly filtered water leaking out of the Clean bag if it is being filled from the filter line at certain angles.

Also as noted by others, I hear nothing back from the Cascade Designs warranty team after filling out about one form per year. I wouldn't complain about purchasing it a new bag if it were more reasonably priced.
review.name: Seam Failure

review.reviewBody: I love the system, but the receiving reservoir is just a waste of money and resources. I filter directly into clean Platypus water bags (1 and 2 liter). You should sell just the â€œdirtyâ€ reservoir with a Platypus connector below the filter on the outlet hose.
review.name: Sell the â€œdirtyâ€ reservoir only as an option

name: GravityWorks 2.0L Dirty Reservoir Replacement Kit

review.reviewBody:
And I'm pretty sure that's the point!

I've been on the mountain with these since the start of the season and they have me really impressed. The red-tinted lens does a very good job of enhancing contrast, and if you never look through a Prizm or Chromapop lens you won't have a complaint. It's just not quite on the same leve that you get from Smith or Oakley. However, what these lack (only marginally) in contrast-boosting dyes they more than make up for with the VLT-adjusting tech. Last time out I got all 4 seasons in a few hours and the photochromic lens was as advertised. I didn't really notice it change tint as the sky went from heavily overcast and snowy to almost bluebird sunny, but I also never felt like I had the wrong lens on. Meanwhile, my buddy swapped out the lenses on his Smiths at least twice over the course of the day.

As for comfort, the frame and foam feel fine. Oakley is in another league with their foam in my opinion, but the Cyrius's flexible frame should help these fit a wide variety of faces and the foam is more than comfortable enough for a full day on the mountain.

The one thing I haven't been able to do in these is night riding but based on my experience in low light so far, I'd bet you could get away with it.

Basically these goggles work well enough to make you forget you're wearing them.
review.name: You won't notice them...
comment: Thanks for posting such a great, useful review! Any thoughts about whether there is enough room for low-profile eyeglasses under these goggles on an otherwise medium face?

name: Cyrius Photochromic Goggles

review.reviewBody: I've been backpacking for 30 years and the gear has come a very long way! The MSR Hubba Hubba 2 tent is by far the best designed all around tent I have used and owned. I can't believe a fellow backpacker would give a tent 1 star because they don't like the color. What has this world come too? Disregard the fashion police below, this is an awesome tent and I'm a fan of the new colors myself which have no effect on the performance and quality of this tent. This tent hit all of my "must haves", spacious interior, ample head room to sit up and change clothes, double sided doors so I'm not crawling over everything to get in or out, super light weight, easy setup and did I tell you about the fantastic colors? I love this tent!
review.name: Great Tent - MSR Hubba Hubba 2

name: Hubba Hubba Tent: 2-Person 3-Season

review.reviewBody: Very nice product with one problem - I think a quality problem.  One leg of the knickers is not as tight as the other - so it doesn't stay mild calf.  It rises up to just below knee. Leg is colder and I look weird.  Just to be sure I measured my calf circumference of both legs - the same.  So, fault is quality of construction. Sewing factories are never perfect.
review.name: One Leg Not Tight

review.reviewBody: I have had these for over four years now. I've ridden with them a lot. They do keep me warm. I'll give them that. Unlike my Castelli and Gore knickers, they don't stay up without the straps on. I don't ride without the straps on; that just demonstrates their lack of compression. Even with the straps on they do not stay in place. They move around when I ride and can get caught on the nose of the saddle after standing. Kind of reminds me of what shorts often did before I switched to bibs. Should I have bought a medium? Perhaps. Still, I think they would lack compression no matter the size.
review.name: No Compression, No Stability

review.reviewBody: I usually wear a Medium in bibs but these are oversized. No compression in the middle but fit okay through the thighs. Chamois is too large but at the same time a lot of room left over in that area.  "Things" move around. Fabric seems fine but the fit can't get me to like these. I have other Louis Garneau shorts and mediums fit well making this a surprise disappointment.
review.name: Runs large

review.reviewBody:
Bought the first pair in 2013 and put it through the ringer.
When it wore out I just wanted a new pair of exactly the same knickers.

Super comfy, fits great, warm and breathable, chamois is good for really long rides (50-80 miles), and at a budget-friendly price point!

Perfect for shoulder season rides in the PNW.

10/10 would recommend to a friend
review.name: Liked them so much I bought it twice

review.reviewBody: Great comfy Knicker. Perfect length and compression.
review.name: Enduro Bib Knickers 3

name: Enduro Bib Knickers 3 - Men's

review.reviewBody: I love these boots.  Warm and comfy, they look great.  I get compliments every time I wear them!
review.name: I love these boots!

review.reviewBody:
Pros: The boots are stylish, warm and cozy. Warm enough for our Colorado winters, not sure about colder northern climates. I bought this boot because the tread was better than a lot of other boots out there. I thought having to tie them every time would be annoying but you can fix the laces so you can basically wear them like pull on boots with minor adjustments to the laces as needed. I am happy with the boots overall, especially because I got them on sale at the end of the season. 

Cons: I normally wear a 9, but I got a 9.5. This is the right size for me. But even though I have very narrow feet, the toe box is small, and I am left with it feeling slightly cramped when sitting but not standing. Weird. If you have wider feet you might need to go up a full-size or more. These would be worth trying on in person if possible.
review.name: Good but toe box is small

review.reviewBody: Sorel - always a favorite.  These are stylish, comfortable, cozy and warm.  Yes - I ordered a size up.  ðŸ‘ðŸ»
review.name: Great winter boot - Tivoli

review.reviewBody: The reviews were all over the place so I am here as a medium width to review that they are warm and Purrrfect! Super duper happy as i followed the advice of reviewers to order 1/2 size up.  Usually wear a 6.5 in sandals and shoes, ordered this is 7 and I can still wear socks too. I canâ€™t imagine going up a whole size up.  Half size up was perfect and my foot is medium width, not narrow !
review.name: Just order 1/2 size up

review.reviewBody: The quality I count on with Sorel. Beautiful boots. I usually wear a size 7 or 7 1/2. I should have ordered 8 1/2. The 8 were too small, too narrow and I usually wear a narrow shoe.
review.name: Beautiful warm boots

review.reviewBody: They aren't kidding when they tell you to size up. I love these but they run small so had to return. Don't like the restocking fee either.
review.name: Size up
comment: Hello Jackie, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. Weâ€™re sorry that our Women's Tivoliâ„¢ IV Parc Boot is hard to size. Weâ€™re happy to help assist with the issue if you will reach out to our Customer Care team at (888) My-SOREL. Thank you.

review.reviewBody: They are super comfortable and the fur is so soft. Highly recommend going up a full size though. They seem to run slightly narrow and small because of the fur.
review.name: Quality and Size

review.reviewBody: I was excited to get new snow boots for my upcoming winter trips. I am very disappointed with these boots. They have not kept my feet warm at all.  I used to have the UGG Adirondack boots and never had an issue with cold feet. I always wear wool socks thin and thick and was always warm. With these Sorel boots it doesn't matter what wool socks I wear my feet get cold as soon I get outside.  FYI: they also run small. I usually wear a size 6 boot and went up to 6.5.  I'm very sad they aren't working out, they're cute, but looks aren't everything.
review.name: No warmth!
comment: Hello Maryb82, we appreciate you sharing your feedback and we're sorry Women's Tivoliâ„¢ IV Parc Boot didn't meet your standards. We will inform our product team of your concerns and ensure this is fixed for the future.

review.reviewBody: To be fair, I havenâ€™t had a chance to wear them yet, thus the 4 instead of 5 stars, our Michigan weather has been too warm, and not enough snow. But my initial try-on was great. I sized up 1/2 a size, from 8.5 to a 9 and they fit and feel great. Supportive and comfortable, great looking and are well made.
review.name: Comfortable and well made

review.reviewBody: I love this boot, the style, the structure, and the look.  Unfortunately for me they run small and I had to return them. When I returned them they were out of the next size up. But, if I see them again I will purchase a pair.
review.name: Runs Small

review.reviewBody:
Iâ€™ve been rocking my older Breeze boots for over 4 years, so I couldnâ€™t resist trying the new Breeze in size 9W. So far, theyâ€™re just as fantastic! Of course, I havenâ€™t logged as many miles in them yet, but theyâ€™re just as lightweight and breathable as my trusty pair.

I love the modern look of these boots in the Trooper color, and I canâ€™t stress enough how much I appreciate a wide fit for hiking. Vasque is my go-to for a reasonâ€”they last and keep my feet happy! Iâ€™m really pleased with this style.
review.name: A Fresh Take on a Trusted Favorite!
comment: Thanks for this great review! It's exciting that  your new boots are doing the trick for you! We can't wait to continue serving you.

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable after a 10 mile break-in. True to size. Thank you for making wide sizes. Even though they are water-proof these boots do not run hot. Great ankle stability. Will purchase again.
review.name: Very comfortable, does not run hot!
comment: This is such a great review! I am so glad they are working well for you no matter the terrain.

review.reviewBody:
I have been wearing breeze for five yrs now. I have tried other brands and they just arenâ€™t as comfortable.  I have a more narrow foot. Oboz would be my next choice but I find they are for a wider foot. 
I wear them almost everyday, hiking and working hard!!  Vasque rocks!
review.name: Most comfortable shoe!!!

review.reviewBody: I wear this everyday almost. Out to see my horses in the muck, running through the fields, hiking, puddle jumping, to the grocery store. They are the best and I will definitely replace them when they finally die
review.name: Favorite boots
comment: Thank you for this great review! We are so glad you have had a great experience with these! We hope to continue to serve you.

review.reviewBody: Iâ€™ve had them for a couple of months and I love them. They were comfortable immediately and didnâ€™t need to be broken in. They provide great support for weak ankles but are still light and somehow not hot on summer hikes. The color was more red than I was expecting, but itâ€™s still muted.
review.name: I love these boots

review.reviewBody:
I bought the new breeze 6 months ago and had to change the shoe laces. My old breeze has a 60 inch lace. The new breeze ls 56 inches. The lace is too short. Go back to a 60 inch lace!!
The toe box is also lower than the breeze III-the top of my toes hit the top of the toe box, especially going down hill. And the sole has much less support than the breeze III. Cutting corners is very apparent in the new Breeze and is not appreciated.
review.name: Short shoe laces
comment: Thank you for your comments and suggestions. We hope to continue serving you in the future!

review.reviewBody:
I had to get a pair of boots for my new job. I work at a greenhouse and am on my feet for 9 hours a day, pulling very heavy (900#) carts up to 15 miles a day. I was excited when I found the Vasquez woman's breeze. Loved the color, and they were the perfect width of I went up a size. Although the VERY flat soles made my feet hurt, I was mostly satisfied my first day wearing them. Unfortunately they aren't waterproof whatsoever. Every day I get home, take my boots off and find my socks wet. No, it's not sweat.... It's where the mesh parts are on the top of the shoe. Pan to today. I worked 2 days ago. Here I am getting ready for work, go to put my boots on, and they are STILL WET INSIDE! THATS 48 HOURS! It's summer, it's not humid, they should be bone dry even if they were wet. 
I'm super disappointed in these boots. The only thing I'm actually happy with is how light weight they are. Unfortunately, I'm stuck with them because I can't afford a new pair of boots.
review.name: Not waterproof
comment: Thank you for your review! We are sorry to hear your boots are not performing as expected. We will reach out to you directly to do what we can to assist via email.

review.reviewBody: My boots were brand new and I wore them once for a day hike last week. There was still some snow left in the trail, but I told myself it didn't matter as I was wearing brand new waterproof boots. I was so wrong. After just a few hours, my feet were soaking wet. I'm very disappointed by this first Vasque purchase.
review.name: Nothing close to waterproof

review.reviewBody: Wore these on a 1.5 week long west coast road trip. No break in period at all. I wore them through Yosemite, 14 mile-hike through the Red Woods, and days in Washington (Mt. Rainer and Olympic National). I had to give my husband piggy-back rides through puddles and mud to keep his feet dry. I walked through ankle deep water and walked away completely dry. Not to mention I have wide feet and my feet felt fresh at the end of each day.
review.name: Hiked It. LOVED IT.
comment: Thank you for this amazing review! It sounds like these boots had quite the adventure with you and we hope they continue on many more!

review.reviewBody: I wire these for the first time today. They give great support and are very comfortable. The reason for the two star rating is because they did not keep my socks dry. . I walked through damp grass, and when I got home my socks were wet.
review.name: Good support not waterproof
comment: We are glad that you are comfortable, but we also want you to have dry feet. We will contact you via email to assist you.

name: Breeze Hiking Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody:
After getting a Yeti SB100 with GX and riding a bit with it I thought the DTs 1900 (25mm inner) and the DHF/Aggressor combo was a bit too much for someone like me, who rides mostly singletrack and trails here in Minnesota (Elm Creek, Cuyuna, etc). The bike is excellent (coming from a 26er 2005 Rocky Mountain Slayer 50 with DHF/Aggressor) but it felt like it could use a setup that would be  bit lighter for faster climbing and longer, more XC-style rides.
While everybody may want carbon, including me, I just wanted a solid and strong rim that was light. For around 1550g for the set it competes with carbon hoops and while they may not have the same riding feel (I haven't ridden carbon MTB wheels, so ignorance may be bliss in my case) they compare with most of them in terms of weight.  
I also wanted to experience the instant engagement that everybody has been raving about. While I was leaning towards Onyx (Minnesota!) a friend in the industry told me I would end up loving Hydra's buzz and performance, and they are lighter than the Onyx, which is what I was looking for. He wasn't wrong. The sound is very cool and the instant engagement is amazing. I don't think I would ever not want future hubs to not have similar or the same performance. I am hooked. 
Being 162lbs heavy and around 172-175 with gear, I thought the 24 holes would be perfect, especially since I like to ride fast but don't do huge airs, drops, or ride gnarly and rocky terrains. I paired them with Rekon 2.4 and Rekon Race 2.35 and the difference is very noticeable. Not only the instant engagement allows for faster acceleration and an overall better and smoother ride up or down, the way I can handle the wheels especially while descending is amazing, it just feels easier. I feel like the rider input is translated a lot quicker and without as much effort. The weight savings make it such a fast and nimble wheel and the bike feels just like that: faster and more nimble, with much better acceleration. 
The laser engraved graphics and the quality of the spokes are insane. The attention to detail is there in spades. The quality is superb and I don't hesitate a second to recommend i9 to other friends and fellow riders. I honestly can only say great things about this wheelset. For a second I thought I should have spent more money for a higher end component SB100 but I am glad I went this route and invested on this wheel upgrade for the most modest SB100 model.  
After selling the stock wheel-tire combo the SB100 came with and being able to get these on a 20% one item discount promo deal, I ended up setting myself back around $750 for the black hub and black spokes version, but the difference in performance is definitely worth the investment, so I couldn't be happier. Highly recommend if you want a strong, fast and versatile trail wheelset for singletrack, trail, and long rides. 
Competitve Cyclist's service and shipment was extraordinary, as per usual. Thank you for this amazing set!
review.name: Just what I wanted -

name: Hydra Trail 270 29in Boost Wheelset

review.itemreviewed: Chrono Sport Halter Bib Short - Women's
review.reviewBody: Very comfortable in the way it fits and the chamois.  The only reason I don't normally wear bibs is that you have to completely take off your jersey to be able to go to the restroom.  I thought the halter would be easier.  It definitely works, the band around your neck is super stretchy so it will go over your helmet.  I find that it helps if I unzip my jersey a little though since the bibs go up so high.  I can't say that it saves a ton a time from the conventional bibs, but I like that you don't have to get completely undressed to be able to take a nature break!
review.name: Great bibs!

review.reviewBody:
Years ago, I got the 26" X-King, which is a similar tread, for my 125 pound intermediate wife. She tore those tires up within ten miles or so.
I decided to give them another try, in the reincarnated Cross King version, 29x2.3 and they have definitely solved the durability problem!
750 grams, 2.28" carcass width at sub 20 psi and knobs slightly wider. 
If you like the Rocket Ron or the Rekon, you'll like these. They roll fast and hook up well. I've only tried them on the back, but they work well on the mellower XC type trails on the Wasatch Back. I decided I needed a little more traction, so I went to a Mountain King on the back, and wrote a review on those, but if you don't need more rear wheel traction than a Rekon, for example, these are 5 star.
BTW, I did not notice the stiff sidewalls described and in fact, found them supple. Similar to a 29x2.35 Nobby Nic, or Rekon, in fact, but grippier than the Rekon.
review.name: Yep, pretty durable!

name: Cross King 29in Tire

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love everything about this jacket. I am 5â€™11â€ so I usually have trouble with the sleeve length - not with this one, it is long enough for me!! I love the removable hood and the lining inside the pocket, it is so soft which is nice especially in colder weather. Great color as well (I got the vetiver).
review.name: Quality jacket!

review.reviewBody: The best coat. This is my second one. I wore the other one out after several years. Itâ€™s very versatile and works for a range of temperatures. I also like that it has longer sleeves as I am tall 5â€™11â€. I was thrilled I could buy another one!
review.name: The best coat

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a very comfortable, cute looking jacket. I like the fur on the hood and the hood isnâ€™t too large that it flops over my face when I pull it up. I love the color, it is warm and fits well. I normally wear a medium in most tops, except Marmot. This is a large and I like that it fits me well, sleeves and length are great.
review.name: Warm, cute winter jacket!

review.reviewBody:
A great jacket
Warm but not bulky.  I love the color- purple fig
Fits nicely except sleeves are a little too long 
I like the fact that the hood is removable 
I also like the inside security pocket 
It does shed some feathers - not a lot and I am hoping that it is only because it is new and the shedding will subside
 I would definitely recommend this jacket
review.name: Jacket with some nice features

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect in every way. Well designed,  very comfortable,  not too bulky and beautiful color.

I opted for the XS as the S looked just a tad overlarge if I wasnâ€™t layering, and the XS fit just right. That mattered more to me personally than extra room for a bulky sweater. Very warm, beautiful, and unexpectedly soft jacket.

description: Buy the Deuter Fox 40+4L Backpack - Kids' online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Fox 40+4L Backpack - Kids'
hasVariant.description: Buy the Deuter Fox 40+4L Backpack - Kids' online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: My 12 year old daughter wore this for our summer backpacking trip.  She typically hates wearing backpacks but this one was comfortable and held all the things she needed (sleeping bag, pad, clothes, headlamp, water, snacks, and some odds and ends).  She was comfortable and happy - highly recommend.
review.name: Great kid / tween backpacking backpack!

review.reviewBody: Bought this for my 14 yr old son for a 2-day trip.  Super easy to pack with lower zip compartment and easily adjustable to his size.  Very comfortable for 19miles!
review.name: Great backpack!

review.reviewBody: Watched a video of it and found that it would fit me (5â€™6, 110 lbs) and took it for a week with me through Europe! It was sturdy and fit a lot. One downside is that it only had a a couple of pockets. But it does have two water bottle holders so it makes up for it!
review.name: Awesome for small women too!

review.reviewBody: Every year I take my kids and many of their friends backpacking (~100 kids in the last decade).  The Fox 30 and 40 are my go-to backpacks for gradeschoolers, and the Fox 40 often works for high schoolers who are on the smaller side.  From the perspectives of both comfort and value, this pack can't be beat to introduce kids to backpacking.  If they are carrying more than this on their first couple trips, they are probably carrying too much for it to be enjoyable.
review.name: Superb Backpack for Kids

review.reviewBody: Great product for the price. He got it for camping trips and family trips and it seems to be a good size for him and holds the items he needs.
review.name: Perfect for 11 year old

review.reviewBody: I was looking for a light layer to wear over my hoodie for light rain and this was exactly what I was looking for.
review.name: Great light outer layer

review.reviewBody:
Helly makes amazing products. I love this jacket. Itâ€™s well made and looks great. I would say that it is not as lightweight as some other top layer coats and could use zippered vents under the arms, as many trekking/outdoor top layers have. Additionally, the hood collar isnâ€™t fully lined. It just has a little patch at the mouth. I have a competitor top layer jacket that the collar and pockets are lined and the underarms have vents. Itâ€™s also lighter so packing when stripping layers is much better. 

Lastly, I am 6,2 not a large man but tall. Iâ€™ve tried the large and cal. The Xtra large is pretty big, great for winter layers but the sleeves are very long whereas the large the sleeves fit perfectly but the torso is trim and a little short. So it runs small and it runs large.
review.name: HH Seven J
