review.reviewBody:
I've been training for an endurance event and have dipped my toes into carb mixes. I've tried SIS and really didn't like the flavor, so was surprised to see how much I liked the Tailwind mix. I ordered the single-serving packets for traveling, and they've been super convenient to use. It's also super easy to mix and dissolves quickly compared to more generic hydration mixes and tablets. I've tried both the berry and mandarin flavors, and I have a slight preference for mandarin. 

To anyone who hasn't tried a carb mix before, they're great for supplementing your nutrition, especially on very long rides where you should be taking in lots of carbs and calories per hour. I like this mix because it's easy on your stomach, as some astronaut food can upset the tummy when you're really goin' at it.
review.name: Great carb mix, no tummy issues!

review.reviewBody: I bought this back in September for the Oz Trails Epic off-road 30 mile XC race and it helped keep me going, but it could over come my lack of conditioning, lol.  I used it many time since then and find it as a great way to keep fueled for longer rides 2 hours plus. I would definitely recommend this.
review.name: Great taste for an endurance mix

review.reviewBody: I got the mandarin orange flavor. I tend to like citrus flavors but I think I'll try the berry next. This one is ok but a touch bland. Seems to do the job. Did a 100k in hot Texas summer heat, using this. Finished well hydrated. I used Scratch Labs previously and can't tell any difference.
review.name: So far so good

review.reviewBody: Ive been using this drink as this as my go to sports drink for the last year. As a vegan, not all drinks are made available for my diet but this one is and does the trick. Its mainly used to help fuel my 6+ hour rides and have had no stomach issues. Each scoop is about 200 calories which is perfect to help when space can be an issue and you need some liquid calories. Ive sampled all the flavors and the caffeine ones. Not overly sweet and I actually look forward to drinking when I have them in the bottle. Check out their recovery drink as well, top notch nutrition.
review.name: Doesnt get much better than this

name: Endurance Fuel

review.reviewBody: Love this jacket! Itâ€™s super light yet keeps me completely warm. I live in northern WA and will wear this with a t-shirt underneath; it keeps me warm in 30-40 degree weather! Havenâ€™t tried colder but weâ€™ll see this winter!

review.reviewBody: One month in and I find myself grabbing this jacket a lot. Great fit and the stretch makes it easy to move and drive in. My only suggestion would be to make a 800 or 850 fill in the Stretchdown lineup so there was a warmer option.

review.reviewBody: I love this hoodie/jacket. Itâ€™s warm, lightweight and packable. It stretches. I get a lot of compliments wearing it. I wear it all the time.

review.reviewBody: Exactly what I wanted in a mid layer down jacket. Perfect for sub 15 degree (f) days under the shell for slope use. Nice and light weight, comfortable and most importantly stretchy which is what I wanted from other down jackets. Inside drop pockets are a nice convenience. Iâ€™m 5â€™10 170lbs and a medium fits exactly how I want it to. Thank you MH for coming out with a thinner version of the stretch down jacket.
review.name: My go to mid layer down jacket

review.reviewBody: Great coat. Super light weight and the stretch is just enough to give your arms and body more freedom of movement. Pocket sizes are good on exterior and interior. As noted in previous reviews, no chest pocket, but not a dealbreaker for me.
review.name: Stellar Coat

review.reviewBody:
I got this jacket to play golf int eh winter and it has been stellar - it i not a tight fit and the material is thin, so it works for a wide range of temperatures. It is surprisingly warm - like with all jackets in the cold it needs to fit your waist snugly or you need to have a baselayer that fills up the gap and prevents wind from getting underneath. I wear this one a lot - it kind of works its way into your rotation and tends to shove all the other jackets out :) 

Thilled is my simple review. It is typical Mountain Hardware all around, and if you are looking for a v ery versatile thin down jacket, this is the one.
review.name: Amazing Jacket

review.reviewBody: Love the jacket and itâ€™s been a great addition to my adventures
review.name: Itâ€™s an Awesome Jacket. Itâ€™s warm and light weight so easy to utilize.

review.reviewBody: Nice looking and very lightweight. Good for late autumn and early winter. Iâ€™d go with something heavier if itâ€™s below 25F, but this is great for the purpose.

description: Buy the Big Agnes Spicer Peak Tent: 6-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Spicer Peak Tent: 6-Person 3-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the Big Agnes Spicer Peak Tent: 6-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
The Big Agnes Spicer Peak Tent is a great option for families or groups seeking a well-designed, high-quality tent that balances functionality and convenience. While it's not the easiest solo setup, it offers plenty of thoughtful features that make it a reliable choice for camping trips, rain or shine.

This tent is fairly easy to set up, though having two peopleâ€”one at least 5'6"â€”is helpful, especially for securing the rainfly pole and cover due to their height. The materials and build feel sturdy, and the design includes thoughtful details, like strategically placed features that make camping more convenient.

The tent provides ample room to stand up inside, which is especially appreciated during inclement weather. It strikes a perfect balance between spaciousness and portabilityâ€”roomy without being oversized or cumbersome. As a family of seven, we plan to take this tent across the country alongside our Marmot 3-person tent. Itâ€™s convenient, well-sized, and fits perfectly into our camping lifestyle.

The one thing I would change is the zippers on the doors. I wish they were separating zippers, as Iâ€™ve used those on many other tents and find them easier to handle. Having the zipper meet at the bottom of the tent takes some getting used to and feels less practical compared to other designs.

This tent is perfect for families or small groups who need a reliable and well-sized tent for car camping or extended trips. It's especially good for those who might encounter unpredictable weather, thanks to its spacious interior that allows for standing room without feeling overbuilt.

Overall, the Big Agnes Spicer Peak Tent is a solid choice for anyone looking for a durable, well-designed tent with plenty of room to move around. Itâ€™s easy to recommend for family trips, though an adjustment to the door zippers would make it even better.
review.name: Great Family Tent with Room to Stand and

review.reviewBody: It fits a queen mattress and has plenty of room for dog beds!
review.name: Love this tent, itâ€™s like a small bedroo

name: Spicer Peak Tent: 6-Person 3-Season

review.itemreviewed: Flashflight Rechargeable Light Up Flying Disc - Disc-O Tech
review.reviewBody:
On my 3rd disk , my dog picks up byvthe edge but flips it over and caries it byvthe removable center piece and obviously it comes out and there goes the LED and battery's into the snow . Gone till spring. 
Most likely won't buy another one or any other product. 
Instead of a push cap , maybe a screw on cap would work better .
review.name: Great idea ,poor finish
comment: Hi there, we are sorry to hear about the issues you have been having with the Flashflight flying disc. We do make a Flashflight Dog Discuit specifically made for fetch with your dog. We would be happy to send that as a replacement through our Worry-Free Guarantee. Just reach out to us at info@niteize.com and we will get you taken care of.

review.itemreviewed: Flashflight Rechargeable Light Up Flying Disc - Disc-O Tech
review.reviewBody:
There's a cap on the LED board that detaches and disappears in the grass very easily. I already lost it once and it was even before it left my house. The board charges using USB MINI which is now very outdated technology. Charging the battery took so that long time. It was over a number of hours, and we lost interest in playing with it. 

Light up wise, it's ok. Definitely not as pictured but I didn't expect it to be. I only bought this to be able to extend my evenings a bit.
review.name: Uses USB Mini and charges sloooowly

review.itemreviewed: Flashflight Rechargeable Light Up Flying Disc - Disc-O Tech
review.reviewBody: Long overdue: I brought my first one to a music festival and it became my festival identity from that day forward. Itâ€™s really a light up flying jelly fish. People get such a kick out of it. Iâ€™ve brought it with me on countless trips and festivities including burning man so itâ€™s pretty much in every picture taken of me. Itâ€™s even incorporated into my dance moves where I spin it around my finger in various ways. Friends can always find me if they just look for the frizz. Thereâ€™s always that moment though when I put it down or let someone play with it and forget. Next comes panicâ€¦ â€œwhereâ€™s the frizz!â€ My friends know that means all hands on deck to find it. Iâ€™ve lost many to rooftops but mostly I give them away to worthy encounters after a good session cause they really gave it there all and impressed me lol. I know theyâ€™ll appreciate it. Itâ€™s brought me an incredible amount of joy. Ok one more storyâ€¦after my friends and a got back to our condo on a golf course from a certain festival in the Palm Springs area. We went out on the golf course in the pitch black and launched the electrified jelly fish to each other only by the sound of our voice. I highly recommend. Such a magical product. Thank you Nite Ize.
review.name: I fell in love with this disc 8-9 years ago

review.itemreviewed: Flashflight Rechargeable Light Up Flying Disc - Disc-O Tech
review.reviewBody: Seems sturdy.  Havenâ€™t used much because of the weather but lights up nice.  However, the led module came completely off the first time I removed the outer plastic cap to charge up.  Looks like the hot glue didnâ€™t hold up.  Iâ€™m worried the light will be gone soon since itâ€™s not secure.
review.name: Mostly Good
comment: Hi Scott! Thanks for the feedback -- the module is made to be easily accessed so the batteries can be switched out and replaced when needed! You can see more about this here: https://youtu.be/et_KU6OMoRk

review.itemreviewed: Flashflight Rechargeable Light Up Flying Disc - Disc-O Tech
review.reviewBody: This is the best disc I have ever played with! Strong, colorful, brilliant flight, and it floats!
review.name: Best Disc Ever

review.itemreviewed: Flashflight Rechargeable Light Up Flying Disc - Disc-O Tech
review.reviewBody: The unit was easy to charge.  The LED assembly fell out, but was easy to replace and everything worked fine.  We spent a good hour playing with it at the beach in Clearwater Florida waiting to ring in the new year.  Everyone loved it.  It has the 'cool' factor.  The disk went into the ocean a couple of times, but the seal cap seemed to do a fine job of keeping the water out so no harm happened to the electronics.  So far I am happy with this purchase.
review.name: Beach tested and approved

review.itemreviewed: Flashflight Rechargeable Light Up Flying Disc - Disc-O Tech
review.reviewBody: I bought this product as a Christmas gift for my son.  He is 24 and throwing frisbee with friends is one of his favorite things to do.  He did like the fact you could charge it usb.  I am positive he is getting lots of fun time with it.
review.name: Christmas gift for my son

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I ordered a medium which is what I usually buy in coats & it's a great fit.  The quality of fabric is excellent, as well as the construction. Such detail, even the hood is lined. If you're looking for one to keep you warm this can do it.
review.name: Best cold weather coat

review.reviewBody: Wore this yesterday on one of the coldest days of the year in NYC.  30 degrees and below with blustery wind.  I appreciated the knit wrist which blocked wind from entering.  I typically wear a M in Marmot.  But I ordered a Small for a trimmer fit and I am glad i did.  I am a 36 bust for reference. The cropped jacket flairs a little bit out.  Wore with a t shirt.  Felt a little cool outside in the cold but felt overheated when in doors so really you should wear something warmer than a t-shirt its not an arctic parka but its great for under 40 degrees and under with the right thin thermal layers.  Go regular size if you like wearing layers or thicker sweaters or hoodies.  Arm holes and sleeves are trim.
review.name: Cute Cropped NYC Coat

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] love love love the color. It does look like a stormy sky.  It is short as described which means paying attention that your top isn't longer.  But the boxy fit accommodates my large bust very well.  Super high quality as with all Marmot.  I will enjoy this one.
review.name: short warm jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This coat is cute! I am glad that i caught this on sale too. The color is more so like a light olive, it's NOT grey at all so please do not believe those other reviews, it also runs true to size i am really top have in the bust area and a XL fit perfect! Wear this coat with some skinny jeans and boots you're good to go! It's a casual  coat i would say as well i would hope Marmot makes this in a navy color for winter 2024-2025 or even a deep olive green
review.name: Styling and Profiling in NYC

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fabulous coat. Was looking for a color more like in the photos.
review.name: Great coat, but color appears grey not tan

name: Chelsea Short Coat - Women's

description: Buy the Mountainsmith K-9 Bed online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: K-9 Bed
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountainsmith K-9 Bed online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I bought this bed in 2021 for $33 ($40 MSRP). Thereâ€™s absolutely no justification for it to be $99 MSRP in 2024. The product is unchanged. 

Itâ€™s an excellent packable bed, washes easily. But itâ€™s not worth a 250% price hike when peak inflation is 7-8%. Just saying.
review.name: Inflation BAD

review.reviewBody: Bought this to use in place of a fleece blanket we've been using.  My dog is a border collie and there is ample room for him on it.  Packs down to 3/4 the size of a 3# coffee can in the included mesh stuff sack.  Overall I'm happy with it and would recommend.
review.name: Dog likes it

review.reviewBody: My dog tries to sleep on top of me if he doesn't have a designated place to go in the tent, and this bed fits the bill. My dog doesn't like to be covered or to nestle in a sleeping bag, so some of the more expensive dog sleeping bags aren't worth the investment for us. I still plan on putting a pad down for him in the early spring/fall for additional insulation, but this bed is a solid option for the price. My dog is about 80lbs and this is a great size for him.
review.name: Solid dog bed

name: K-9 Bed

description: Buy the Greys Lance Fly Rod online or shop all Fishing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Lance Fly Rod
hasVariant.description: Buy the Greys Lance Fly Rod online or shop all Fishing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I watched some of the YouTube reviews on this rod that made it sound phenomenal for the price. I have to say Iâ€™m pretty underwhelmed. Donâ€™t get me wrong, itâ€™s not a bad rod, but paired with the relatively cheap fly line I am using I am not impressed. I think if I put a premium line on here it would cast a lot better, but then again just about any rod casts well with a high-end line. I will say the rod feel is really good once your line is in the water. I can clearly feel whatâ€™s going on at the end of my line which compared to the cheap/old rods I normally use is pretty nice. The grip and hardware all look really nice as well. The grip shape and quality of the cork are good too.
review.name: Over-rated

name: Lance Fly Rod

review.reviewBody: While these pants may be comfy, you are definitely guaranteed to get wet.  Every single time I have been out, even if the littlest water touches my legs, I am wet.  My dry top keeps me dry...with these pants, even with neoprene booties on, I am soaked in the feet -- as well as my whole lower body.  Highly recommend not purchasing.
review.name: Do Not Purchase
comment:
Hey Kayla! 

I'm sorry to hear about your experience with the pants. Hopefully you contacted a Gearhead to try to troubleshoot this. These are a 100% waterproof dry pant! So they definitely should not be getting you that level of wet.

Please feel free to reach out to a Gearhead in the event you have a defective pair--we are always happy to send out a free replacement or exchange for a totally different pair of pants

I have these and had the opposite experience. They work great; maybe it?s because I?m wearing them in cold water and not perspiring much. I wore the men?s version on a ~hundred mile packrafting and mountaineering trip as both my paddle pants and shell pants. The attached booties kept my feet warm through multiple days of snow and glacier travel. I have swam in them as well and while they obviously are not a drysuit they do keep an some water out if you can get back in your boat quickly.

name: Hydrus 3l Tempest Pant - Women's
